intro: Leptonychia banahaensis var. papuana, commonly known as the Papuan flatleaf, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Papua. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair, aiding in water retention in its native habitat. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
